derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (in sense 1): of unknown origin; perhaps imitative of a small explosion. The verb was first recorded in sense 2 (late 16th cent.)

entry.tran: 未取得预期效果的事;失败;落空
entry.def: You can describe something such as an event or a performance as a damp squib when it is expected to be interesting, exciting, or impressive, but fails to be any of these things.

example.ex: The all-party meeting was a damp squib.
example.tran: 全党大会没有取得预期效果。

means.word_mean: 1. firework consisting of a tube filled with powder (as a broken firecracker) that burns with a fizzing noise
